jparsec.ephem.event

Class EventReport

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.event.EventReport

  • public class EventReport
extends java.lang.Object
    Methods to report different kind of astronomical events using an RSS feed.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

      • maximumAccuracy

        public static boolean maximumAccuracy
        Maximum accuracy or not for planetary events. True means a few minutes of error at most, false a few hours.

      • occultationsConjunctionsStarMaglim

        public static float occultationsConjunctionsStarMaglim
        Limiting magnitude for the conjunction between different objects. Default values are 5 for stars, 10 for objects, and 9 for planets.

      • occultationsConjunctionsObjectMaglim

        public static float occultationsConjunctionsObjectMaglim

      • getEvents

        public static java.util.ArrayList<SimpleEventElement> getEvents(TimeElement init,
                                                TimeElement end,
                                                ObserverElement obs,
                                                EphemerisElement ephIn)
                                                         throws JPARSECException
        Returns the set of astronomical events between two given dates. Events are sorted in crescent order of date. Note this method requires a few hours in a reasonably fast computer to complete if everything is activated. The events calculated are:

        Solar and lunar eclipses.

        Moon phases, perigee and apogee, maximum/minimum declination.

        Equinoxes and solstices, Earth's perihelion and aphelion.

        Mercury and Venus transits on the Sun.

        Meteor showers.

        Planetary perihelions, aphelions, oppositions (or maximum elongations), and conjunctions. Mercury and Venus perigee.

        Minima/maxima of variable stars.

        New year in different calendars.

        (*) Sunrise/sunset in lunar craters Ptolemaeus, Gassendi, Plato, and Alphonsus (times of frequent Lunar Transient Phenomena) + Lunar-X phenomena.

        (*) Occultation of planets, stars, deep sky objects, comets and asteroids by the Moon.

        (*) Transits of comets or asteroids in front of the Sun.

        (*) Comets/asteroids visible to the naked eye.

        (*) Close-approach of NEOs.

        (*) Time change due to DST.

        (*) Conjunctions between outer planets, comets, and asteroids, between Moon and planets, between planets/Moon and stars, and between deep sky objects and outer planets, comets, or asteroids.

        (*) Eclipses, transits, shadow transits, and occultations of natural satellites in Jupiter, Saturn, and Uranus.

        (*) Mutual events for the satellites of Jupiter, Saturn, and Uranus.

        (*) Events calculated considering the location of the observer, the other events are 'geocentric'.

        In the last two cases calculations are performed with the 'optimize' flag enabled in the constructor of the MoonEvent object. Values for precision and accuracy are 300 and 30 for normal events and 100 and 30 for mutual events, respectively.

        Parameters:
        init - Initial date.
        end - Final date.
        obs - The observer.
        ephIn - The ephemeris properties.
        Returns:
        The set of events.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getFeed

        public static Feed getFeed(java.util.ArrayList<SimpleEventElement> list,
           ObserverElement obs)
                    throws JPARSECException
        Creates an RSS feed with astronomical events. The description of the events is set according to the current language.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of events.
        obs - The observer.
        Returns:
        The feed populate with events.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
